summary.long: Hebrews is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: God, having spoken many times and in many ways in time past unto the fathers by the prophets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: has in these last times spoken unto us by his Son, whom he has appointed heir of all things, by whom also he made the ages;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who being the brightness of his glory and the express image of his substance and upholding all things by the word of his power, when he had by himself purged our sins, sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: being made so much better than the angels, as he has by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unto which of the angels did he say at any time, Thou art my Son, this day I have begotten thee? And again, I will be to him a Father, and he shall be to me a Son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again, when he brought in the firstbegotten into the world, he said, And let all the angels of God worship him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the angels he said, Who makes his angels spirits and his ministers a flame of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But unto the Son he said, Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: a rod of equity is the sceptre of thy kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast loved righteousness and hated iniquity; therefore, God, even thy God, has anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Thou, Lord, in the beginning hast laid the foundation of the earth; and the heavens are the works of thine hands:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they shall perish; but thou dost remain; and they all shall wax old as doth a garment;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as a vesture shalt thou fold them up, and they shall be changed; but thou art the same, and thy years shall never fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to which of the angels did he say at any time, Sit on my right hand until I make thine enemies thy footstool?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they not all ministering spirits, sent forth in service for the love of those who are the heirs of saving health?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, it is necessary that we with more diligence keep the things which we have heard, so that we do not fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the word spoken by the ministry of angels was steadfast and every rebellion and disobedience received a just recompense of reward,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how shall we escape, if we belittle such great saving health? Which, having begun to be published by the Lord, has been confirmed unto us by those that heard him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God also bearing them witness, both with signs and wonders and with diverse miracles and gifts of the Holy Spirit, distributing them according to his own will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unto the angels he has not subjected the world to come, of which we speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one in a certain place testified, saying, What is man, that thou art mindful of him? or the son of man, that thou dost visit him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou didst make him a little lower than the angels; thou didst crown him with glory and honour and didst set him over the works of thy hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet. For in that he put all in subjection under him, he left nothing that is not put under him. But now we do not see yet that all things are put under him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we see this same Jesus, crowned with glory and honour, who was made a little lower than the angels for the suffering of death, that he by the grace of God should taste death for every man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it was expedient that he, for whom are all things and by whom are all things, preparing to bring forth many sons in his glory, should perfect the author of their saving health through sufferings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For both he that sanctifies and those who are sanctified are all of one, for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, I will declare thy name unto my brethren; in the midst of the congregation I will praise thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again, I will put my trust in him. And again, Behold I and the children which God has given me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself likewise took part of the same, that through death he might destroy him that had the empire of death, that is, the devil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and deliver those who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For verily he did not take the angels, but he took the seed of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore in all things he should be made like unto his brethren, that he might be a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, to make atonement for the sins of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in that he himself has suffered and was tempted, he is also powerful to help those that are tempted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, brethren, saints, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was faithful to him that appointed him over all his house, as also Moses was faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this man was counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who has built the house has more honour than the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every house is built by someone, but he that created all things is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses verily was faithful over all his house, as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken after,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Christ as a son over his own house, which house we are, if we hold fast the confidence and the glorious hope firmly until the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, as the Holy Spirit saith, Today if ye will hear his voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my works forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I was indignant with that generation and said, They do always err from their heart, and they have not known my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I swore in my wrath, They shall not enter into my rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unfaithfulness, to depart from the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But exhort one another daily, while it is called Today, lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence steadfast unto the end;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while it is said, Today if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For some of those that came out of Egypt with Moses, when they had heard, did provoke; howbeit not all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But with whom was he indignant forty years? Was it not with those that had sinned, whose carcasses fell in the wilderness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to whom he swore that they should not enter into his rest, but to those that disobeyed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we see that they could not enter in because of their unbelief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us, therefore, fear, lest a promise being left us of entering into his rest, any of you should seem to come short of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unto us was the gospel preached, as well as unto them, but it did not profit those that heard the word without mixing it with faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For we who have believed do enter into the rest) as he said, As I have sworn in my wrath, they shall not enter into my rest although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he spoke in a certain place of the seventh day like this, And God rested the seventh day from all his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in this place again, They shall not enter into my rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing, therefore, it remains that some must enter therein, and those to whom it was first preached did not enter in because of disobedience;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, he determines a certain day, saying, Today, by David so long a time afterward; as it is said, Today if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if Joshua had given them rest, then he would not afterward have spoken of another day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There remains therefore a rest {Gr. Sabbatismos} for the people of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he that is entered into his rest, he also has ceased from his own works, as God did from his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us therefore make haste to enter into that rest, lest anyone fall after the same example of disobedience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the word of God is alive and efficient and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither is there any created thing that is not manifested in his presence, but all things are naked and opened unto the eyes of him of whom we speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having, therefore, a great high priest who penetrated the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast this profession of our hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we do not have a high priest who cannot sympathize with our weaknesses, but was in all points tempted like as we are, yet without sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us, therefore, come boldly unto the throne of his grace, that we may obtain mercy and find grace to help in time of need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every high priest is taken from among men, constituted on behalf of men in things relating to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who can have compassion on the ignorant and on those that are in error; for he himself is also compassed with weakness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by reason of this he ought, as for the people so also for himself, to offer for sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one takes this honour unto himself, but he that is called of God, as was Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also the Christ did not glorify himself to make himself high priest; but he that said unto him, Thou art my Son; today have I begotten thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he said also in another place, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who in the days of his flesh, when he had offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears unto him that was able to save him from death, was heard because of his reverent fear;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: although he was the Son of God, yet he learned obedience by the things which he suffered;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and being made perfect, he became the author of eternal saving health unto all those that hearken unto him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: named by God high priest after the order of Melchisedec.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of whom we have many things to say and difficult to declare, seeing ye are hard of hearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you should now be teaching others, if we look at the time, yet you need to be taught again which are the first elements of the oracles of God and are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For any one that uses milk is not qualified in the word of righteousness, for he is a babe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But strong food belongs to those that are perfect, even those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, leaving now the word of the beginning of the establishment of the Christ, let us go on unto perfection, not laying again the foundation of repentance from works of death, and of faith in God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the doctrine of the baptisms, and of the laying on of hands, and of the resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this we will indeed do, if God permits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is impossible that those who once received the light and tasted of that heavenly gift and were made partakers of the Holy Spirit
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and likewise have tasted the good word of God and the virtue of the age to come,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have backslidden, be renewed again by repentance, crucifying again for themselves the Son of God and putting him to an open shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the earth which drinks in the rain that comes often upon it and brings forth herbs in season for those by whom it is dressed receives blessing from God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but that which bears thorns and briers is rejected and is near unto cursing, whose end shall be by fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But, beloved, we expect better things than these of you, things near unto saving health, though we thus speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God is not unjust to forget your work and labour of charity which ye have showed in his name, having helped the saints and helping them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we desire that each one of you show the same diligence until the end for the fulfillment of your hope,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye not become slothful, but imitators of those who by faith and patience inherit the promises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when God promised unto Abraham, because he could swear by no greater, he swore by himself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee and multiplying I will multiply thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For men verily swear by the greater, and an oath for confirmation is to them an end of all controversy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In which God, desiring to show more abundantly unto the heirs of promise the immutability of his counsel, confirmed it by an oath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that by two immutable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we might have a strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold upon the hope set before us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which we have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and steadfast, and which enters even into that which is within the veil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where our precursor, Jesus, has entered for us and is made high priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this Melchisedec, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom Abraham also gave a tenth part of all; first being by interpretation King of righteousness, and after that also King of Salem, which is King of peace;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: without father, without mother, without lineage, having neither beginning of days, nor end of life, but made like unto the Son of God; abides a priest continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now consider how great this one was, unto whom even the patriarch Abraham gave the tenth of the spoils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And verily those that are of the sons of Levi, who receive the priesthood, have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though they also have come out of the loins of Abraham;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he whose descent is not counted in those took tithes from Abraham and blessed him that had the promises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And without any contradiction the less is blessed of the better.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same manner, here men that die take tithes; but there he received them, of whom it is witnessed that he lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as I may so say, Levi also, who received tithes, paid tithes in Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was yet in the loins of his father, when Melchisedec met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If therefore perfection were by the Levitical priesthood (for under it the people received the law), what further need was there that another priest should rise after the order of Melchisedec and not be called after the order of Aaron?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the priesthood being transposed, there is made of necessity a translation also of the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he of whom these things are spoken pertains to another tribe, of which no one presided at the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is manifest that our Lord sprang out of Juda, of which tribe Moses spoke nothing concerning priesthood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it is yet far more manifest: if there arises another priest who is like unto Melchisedec,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who is not made according to the law of a carnal commandment, but by the virtue of an indissoluble life;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the testimony is of this manner, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is verily a disannulling of the commandment going before for the weakness and unprofitableness of it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the law made nothing perfect, but the bringing in of a better hope did, by which we draw near unto God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even more, inasmuch as it is not without an oath
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for the others indeed without an oath were made priests, but this one with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord swore and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by so much better testament is Jesus made surety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the others, truly, were many priests because they were not able to continue by reason of death:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but this man, because he continues forever, has the intransmissible priesthood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he is able also to save to the uttermost those that come unto God by him, seeing he ever lives to make intercession for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it was expedient that we have such a high priest, who is holy, innocent, undefiled, separate from sinners, and made higher than the heavens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who needs not daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifice, first for his own sins and then for the people’s; for this he did once, when he offered up himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the law makes men high priests who have weakness; but the word of the oath, which was after the law, has made perfect a Son forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now of the things which we have spoken, this is the sum: We have such a high priest who sat down at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a minister of the sanctuary and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, and not man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices; therefore, it is also necessary that this one have something to offer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if he were on earth, he should not even be a priest, being present still the other priests that offer gifts according to the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (who serve as an example and shadow of the heavenly things, as Moses was admonished of God when he was about to make the tabernacle: for, See, saith he, that thou make all things according to the pattern showed unto thee in the mount);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but now a more excellent ministry is his, in that he is the mediator of a better testament, which was established upon better promises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if that first covenant had been faultless, then no place should have been sought for the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For finding fault with them, he said, Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, when I will make a new testament with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not according to the testament that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt, because they did not continue in my testament, and I regarded them not, saith the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is the testament that I will ordain to the house of Israel after those days, saith the Lord: I will give my laws into their soul and write them upon their hearts, and I will be to them a God, and they shall be to me a people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and no one shall teach his neighbour nor anyone his brother, saying, Know the Lord, for all shall know me, from the least to the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will reconcile their iniquities and their sins, and their iniquities I will remember no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that he says, New, he has made the first old. Now that which decays and waxes old is ready to vanish away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless the first had its justifications of worship and its worldly sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there was a tabernacle made: the first, in which was the lampstand and the table and the showbread, which is called the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the second veil was the tabernacle which is called the holy of holies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which had a golden censer and the ark of the covenant overlaid round about with gold, in which was the golden urn that had the manna, and Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tables of the testament,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and over it the cherubim of glory shadowing the seat of reconciliation, of which we cannot now speak particularly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when these things were thus ordained, the priests went always into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the service of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But into the second the high priest went alone once every year, not without blood, which he offered for his own ignorance, and for that of the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Holy Spirit signifying in this, that the way into the sanctuary was not yet made manifest, as long as the first tabernacle was yet standing:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which was a figure of that time present, in which were offered both gifts and sacrifices, that could not make him that did the service perfect, as pertaining to the conscience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in foods and drinks and different washings and carnal ordinances, imposed on them until the time of correction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Christ being now come, high priest of the good things to come, by a greater and more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to say, not of this creation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither by the blood of goats and calves, but by his own blood he entered in once into the sanctuary designed for eternal redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the blood of bulls and of goats and the ashes of a heifer sprinkling the unclean, sanctified to the purifying of the flesh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how much more shall the blood of the Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without spot to God, purge your conscience from the works of death to serve the living God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for this cause he is the mediator of the new testament, so that death intervening for the redemption of the rebellions that took place under the first testament, those who are called might receive the promise of the eternal inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where a testament is, there must also of necessity intervene the death of the testator.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a testament is confirmed by the death: otherwise it is not valid as long as the testator lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From which came that not even the first one was dedicated without blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when Moses had read every commandment of the law to all the people, taking the blood of calves and of goats, with water, and scarlet wool, and hyssop, he sprinkled both the book and all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, This is the blood of the testament which God has commanded unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle and all the vessels of the ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And almost all things are by the law purged with blood, and without shedding of blood there is no remission.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that it was necessary that the figures of the heavenly things should be purified with these, but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Christ is not entered into the sanctuary made with hands (which is a figure of the true), but into the heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor yet that he should offer himself many times (as the high priest enters into the sanctuary each year with blood that is not his own);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: otherwise it would have been necessary for him to suffer many times since the foundation of the world; but now once in the consummation of the ages he has appeared to abolish sin by the sacrifice of himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as it is appointed unto men to die once, and after this the judgment;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so also the Christ is offered once to take away the sins of many; and unto those that wait for him without sin he shall appear the second time unto saving health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the law having a shadow of good things to come, and not the very image of the things, can never make perfect those who come by the same sacrifices which they offer year by year continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, they would cease to offer them, because those that sacrifice, once purged, would have no more conscience of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in these sacrifices each year the same remembrance of sins is made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the blood of bulls and of goats cannot take away sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when he came into the world, he said, Sacrifice and offering thou dost not desire, but a body hast thou prepared me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hast had no pleasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said I, Behold, I come (in the volume of the book it is written of me) to do thy will, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Above when he said, Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and offering for sin thou dost not desire, neither hadst pleasure therein, which are offered by the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he said, Behold, I come to do thy will, O God. He took away the first, that he may establish the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this will, we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus, the Christ, once for all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so every priest stands daily ministering and offering many times the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but this man, after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, is seated at the right hand of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: waiting for that which follows, that is, until his enemies are made his footstool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by one offering he has perfected for ever those that are sanctified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise the Holy Spirit gives us the same witness, who afterwards said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the testament that I will make with them after those days, saith the Lord, I will give my laws in their hearts, and in their souls will I write them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the sanctuary by the blood of Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by a new and living way, which he has consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having that great priest over the house of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts purified from an evil conscience and our bodies washed with pure water;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let us hold fast the profession of our hope without wavering (for he is faithful that promised).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let us consider one another to provoke unto charity and unto good works,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not forsaking our gathering together, as the manner of some is, but exhorting one another and so much the more, when ye see that day approaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if we sin wilfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remains no more sacrifice for sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but a certain fearful hope of judgment and fiery indignation, which shall devour the adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that despised the law of Moses died without mercy under two or three witnesses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of how much greater punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who has trodden underfoot the Son of God and has counted the blood of the covenant, with which he was sanctified, an unholy thing and has done despite unto the Spirit of grace?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we know who he is that has said, Vengeance belongs to me, I will recompense, saith the Lord. And again, The Lord shall judge his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But bring to memory the former days, in which, after ye received the light, ye endured a great fight of afflictions;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on the one hand ye were made a spectacle both by reproaches and tribulations, and on the other ye became companions of those that were so used.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye had compassion of me in my bonds and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing that in yourselves ye have a better substance in the heavens, and that abides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not lose, therefore, this your confidence, which has great recompense of reward;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for patience is necessary, so that after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For yet a little while, and he that shall come will come and will not tarry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the just shall live by faith, but if any man draws back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we are not of those who draw back unto perdition, but faithful unto the saving of the soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Faith, therefore, is the substance of things waited for, the evidence of things not seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by it the elders obtained a good report.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through faith we understand that the ages were framed by the word of God, that which is seen being made of that which was not seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts, and by it he being dead yet speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death, and was not found because God had translated him, for before his translation he had this testimony, that he pleased God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But without faith it is impossible to please God; for he that comes to God must believe that he is and that he is a rewarder of those that diligently seek him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Noah, having received revelation of things not seen as yet, with great care prepared an ark to the saving of his house, by which he condemned the world and was made heir of the righteousness which is by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Abraham, being called, hearkened to go out into the place which he should afterwards receive for an inheritance; and he went out, not knowing where he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith he sojourned in the promised land, as in a strange country, dwelling in booths with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he looked for a city which has foundations, whose builder and maker is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith also Sara herself being sterile received strength to conceive seed and was delivered of a child when she was past age, because she believed him to be faithful who had promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore there sprang even of one, and him as good as dead, so many as the stars of the sky in multitude and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but seeing them afar off and believing them and embracing them and confessing that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For those that say such things declare plainly that they seek their native country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And truly, if they had been mindful of that country from which they came out, they might have had time to have returned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now they desire a better country, that is, a heavenly one; therefore, God is not ashamed to be called their God, for he has prepared for them a city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Abraham, when he was tried, offered up Isaac, and he that had received the promises offered up his only begotten son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of whom it was said, That in Isaac shall thy seed be called,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: accounting that God was able to raise him up, even from the dead; from whence he also received him in a figure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning what they should become.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Jacob, when he was dying, blessed both the sons of Joseph, and worshipped, leaning upon the top of his staff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Joseph, as he died, made mention of the departing of the sons of Israel, and gave a commandment concerning his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Moses, when he was born, was hid three months by his parents because they saw he was a beautiful child, and they were not afraid of the king’s commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Moses, when he was come to years, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: esteeming the reproach of the Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt, for he had respect unto the recompense of the reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king; for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith he kept the passover and the sprinkling of the blood lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith they passed through the Red Sea as by dry land, which the Egyptians attempted to do and were drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down after they were compassed about seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith the harlot Rahab did not perish together with the disobedient, having received the spies with peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what shall I more say? For the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon and of Barak and of Samson and of Jephthae, of David also and Samuel and of the prophets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who by faith won kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, recovered from infirmities, were made valiant in battle, turned to flight the armies of foreign enemies;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: women received their dead raised to life again, and others were tortured, not accepting deliverance that they might obtain a better resurrection;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and others experienced cruel mockings and scourgings, and added to this, bonds and imprisonment;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they were stoned; they were sawn asunder, were tempted, were slain with the sword; they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins; poor, afflicted, mistreated,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (of whom the world was not worthy); they wandered in deserts and in mountains and in dens and caves of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these all, approved by testimony of faith, received not the promise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God having provided some better thing for us, that they without us should not be made perfect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, leaving behind all the weight of the sin which surrounds us, let us run with patience the race that is set before us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with our eyes fixed on Jesus, the author and finisher of our faith, who having been offered joy, endured the cross,{Gr. stauros-stake} despising the shame and was seated at the right hand of the throne of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself lest ye be wearied in your souls and faint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, fighting against sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye have quite forgotten the consolation which speaks unto you as unto sons, My son, despise not thou the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when thou art reproved of him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for whom the Lord loves, he chastens and scourges everyone whom he receives as a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye endure chastening, God deals with you as with sons; for what son is he whom the father does not chasten?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye are without chastisement, of which all the sons are partakers, then ye are bastards, and not sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, we have had fathers of our flesh who corrected us, and we gave them reverence; is it not much better to be in subjection to the Father of spirits, and we shall live?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they verily for a few days chastened us as it seemed good unto them, but he for our profit, that we might be partakers of his holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is true that no chastening at present seems to be cause for joy, but rather for grief; nevertheless, afterward it yields the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto those who are exercised by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, lift up the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and make straight steps unto your feet, so that which is lame will not turn out of the way, but let it rather be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Follow peace with everyone and holiness, without which no one shall see the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: looking diligently that no one deviate from the grace of God, lest any root of bitterness springing up impede you, and thereby many be defiled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest there be any fornicator or profane person as Esau, who for one morsel of food sold his birthright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye know how that afterward, desiring to inherit the blessing, he was rejected; for he found no place of repentance, though he sought it carefully with tears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye are not come unto the mount that might be touched and that burned with fire nor unto blackness and darkness and tempest
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sound of a trumpet and the voice of words, which voice those that heard intreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for they could not endure that which was commanded, and if so much as a beast should touch the mountain, it shall be stoned or thrust through with a dart:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so terrible was the sight that Moses said, I exceedingly fear and quake);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but ye are come unto Mount Sion and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the congregation of the called out ones of the firstborn, who are registered in the heavens and to God the Judge of all and to the spirits of just men made perfect
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to Jesus, the mediator of the new testament and to the blood of sprinkling, that speaks better than that of Abel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See that you do not refuse him that speaks. For if those who refused him that spoke on earth did not escape, much less shall we escape, if we turn away from him that speaks from the heavens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose voice then shook the earth; but now he has promised, saying, Yet even once, I shall shake not the earth only, but also the heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this word, Yet even once, signifies the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that are made, that those things which cannot be shaken may remain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us hold fast to the grace, by which we serve God, pleasing him with reverence and godly fear:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for our God is a consuming fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let brotherly love continue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not forget to show hospitality; for thereby some, having entertained angels, were kept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember those that are in bonds as bound with them and those who suffer adversity as being yourselves also in the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let marriage be honourable in all and the bed undefiled; but the fornicators and adulterers God will judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let your conversation be without covetousness, and be content with such things as ye have; for he has said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that we may boldly say, The Lord is my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember your pastors, who have spoken unto you the word of God, whose faith follow, considering the end of their conversation:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus Christ the same yesterday and today and for the ages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not taken out of the way with diverse and strange doctrines. For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace, not with foods which have not profited those that have been occupied with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have an altar, of which those who serve the tabernacle have no faculty to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the bodies of those animals, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people with his own blood, suffered outside the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us go forth, therefore, unto him outside the camp, bearing his reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For here we have no continuing city, but we seek the one that is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of our lips confessing his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not forget to do good and to fellowship; for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to your pastors, and do not resist them, for they watch for your souls as those that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief; for that is unprofitable for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray for us: for we trust we have a good conscience in all things desiring to conduct ourselves well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I beseech you all the more to do this, that I may be restored unto you sooner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the God of peace, that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the eternal testament,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory for the ages of the ages. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I beseech you, brethren, that ye receive this word of exhortation, that I have written unto you briefly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know ye that our brother Timothy is set at liberty; with whom, if he comes shortly, I will see you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salute all thy pastors and all the saints. The brethren of Italy salute you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace be with you all. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
